speaker: SPEED
text_entry: SCENE VI. The same. The DUKE'S palace.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Enter PROTEUS

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To leave my Julia, shall I be forsworn;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To love fair Silvia, shall I be forsworn;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To wrong my friend, I shall be much forsworn;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And even that power which gave me first my oath

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Provokes me to this threefold perjury;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Love bade me swear and Love bids me forswear.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: O sweet-suggesting Love, if thou hast sinned,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Teach me, thy tempted subject, to excuse it!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: At first I did adore a twinkling star,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But now I worship a celestial sun.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Unheedful vows may heedfully be broken,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And he wants wit that wants resolved will

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To learn his wit to exchange the bad for better.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Fie, fie, unreverend tongue! to call her bad,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Whose sovereignty so oft thou hast preferr'd

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: With twenty thousand soul-confirming oaths.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I cannot leave to love, and yet I do;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But there I leave to love where I should love.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Julia I lose and Valentine I lose:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: If I keep them, I needs must lose myself;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: If I lose them, thus find I by their loss

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: For Valentine myself, for Julia Silvia.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I to myself am dearer than a friend,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: For love is still most precious in itself;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And Silvia--witness Heaven, that made her fair!--

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Shows Julia but a swarthy Ethiope.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I will forget that Julia is alive,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Remembering that my love to her is dead;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And Valentine I'll hold an enemy,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Aiming at Silvia as a sweeter friend.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I cannot now prove constant to myself,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Without some treachery used to Valentine.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: This night he meaneth with a corded ladder

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To climb celestial Silvia's chamber-window,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Myself in counsel, his competitor.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Now presently I'll give her father notice

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Of their disguising and pretended flight;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Who, all enraged, will banish Valentine;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: For Thurio, he intends, shall wed his daughter;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But, Valentine being gone, I'll quickly cross

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: By some sly trick blunt Thurio's dull proceeding.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Love, lend me wings to make my purpose swift,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: As thou hast lent me wit to plot this drift!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Exit
